column2: UTAH DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: UT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column6: improves concentration.
column8: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 2. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column6: They give directional information.
column8: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column10: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 3. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column6: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.

column2: 4. When driving on wet roads, you should remember:
column4: you should give yourself additional time to stop.
column6: to stay farther behind the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: driving on wet roads can cause hydroplaning.

column2: 5. __________________ give you right-of-way to make a left turn.
column6: A flashing red light

column2: 6. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 7. Roads are most slippery:
column6: on hills.
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 8. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 9. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column6: No parking on pavement.

column2: 11. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.

column2: 12. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column6: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.
column8: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.

column2: 13. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 14. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: increase your speed and move to the left.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 15. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column6: Yield to other vehicles
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column10: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 16. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 17. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 18. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 19. As long as you don’t leave the road, you may legally pass a vehicle on the right:
column6: Never.
column8: if you are on a two-lane, two-way road and the other vehicle is turning left.
column10: when you are turning into a one-way street with no oncoming traffic.

column2: 20. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column6: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column8: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column10: pass slower vehicles on the right.

column2: 21. If you need to slow down while driving on a slippery road, you should first:
column6: take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 22. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column6: Call the police.

column2: 23. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: tailgating.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: 4-way stop

column2: 25. Regulation signs normally are:
column6: white triangles.
